summary:
Palestinian gunmen killed at least six people at a Jerusalem bus stop today, and Israeli police killed two attackers, heightening fears of a new escalation in and around Israel and the occupied territories. The attack, which authorities and broadcasters including the BBC and NPR reported, came as the United States presented a new Gaza ceasefire proposal and as Hamas praised the operation, complicating diplomatic efforts to pause fighting. Israeli security forces have launched immediate investigations and stepped up checkpoints and patrols, and officials said arrests and intelligence work are under way; the near-term risk is more tit-for-tat violence and pressure on mediators to produce or abandon a ceasefire within days.

Elsewhere, several fast-moving political and strategic shifts are reshaping markets and policy. In media, the Murdoch family reached a succession deal that leaves Lachlan Murdoch in control of Fox and News Corp, a change investors and regulators will watch for editorial and governance effects. In France, MPs voted no confidence and Prime Minister François Bayrou said he will resign on Tuesday, triggering a cabinet reshuffle and immediate policy uncertainty. A Fourth Circuit panel allowed enforcement of limits on federal diversity, equity and inclusion programs, altering workplace and contracting rules. North Korea tested a new solid-fuel ICBM engine, a technical step that could shorten launch timelines and may prompt tighter sanctions or military readiness measures within weeks.

headlines.title: Palestinian gunmen kill six Israelis at Jerusalem bus stop
headlines.summary: BBC says six Israelis were killed at a Jerusalem bus stop, as two gunmen were killed; the attack prompts renewed security concerns and ongoing investigations.

headlines.title: Murdochs reach deal in succession battle over media empire
headlines.summary: BBC says Lachlan Murdoch will retain control of Fox and News Corp under the deal, sustaining the family's leadership of the media empire.

headlines.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister
headlines.summary: BBC says the government loses a vote of confidence; PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday, likely reshaping the cabinet.

headlines.title: Kim oversees test of new solid-fuel ICBM engine in North Korea
headlines.summary: Al Jazeera says Kim supervised a test of a new solid-fuel rocket engine for North Korea's ICBMs, marking a notable advance in its missile program.

headlines.title: Africa climate summit sparks hopes for green economy boom
headlines.summary: The Guardian says renewables are thriving, solar power expands, but Africa warns financing gaps threaten gains and urges rich nations to boost support ahead of Cop30.

headlines.title: Russia strikes Kyiv government building with Iskander missile, Ukraine says
headlines.summary: France 24 says Russia used an Iskander ballistic missile on a Kyiv government building; the blast left a gaping hole and several dead, with some missiles failing to detonate fully.

headlines.title: Palestinian gunmen kill six in Jerusalem as U.S. offers new Gaza ceasefire proposal
headlines.summary: NPR says Hamas praised the Jerusalem attack that killed six Israelis, while the United States presents a new Gaza ceasefire proposal as Israel steps up attacks.

headlines.title: US appeals court allows DEI crackdown in federal government
headlines.summary: Voice of America says a Fourth Circuit panel ruled the Trump-era DEI directives are likely constitutional, lifting a block on enforcement and letting the administration proceed.

headlines.title: Prabowo replaces five ministers after deadly protests in Indonesia
headlines.summary: Al Jazeera says President Prabowo substituted five ministers, including Sri Mulyani Indrawati, days after protests that saw residents raid her home, signaling a cabinet shake-up.
